content:
Who am I My name is Mingxi Jia. I am a M.S. in Robotics student at Northeastern University, Boston. Before Northeastern, I was a research assistant at BNU-HKBU United International College, working on learning-based object 3D reconstruction, visual-aided robot arm, etc. And, I received my Bachelor of Engineering (in Mechanical Engineering) degree at Beijing University of Chemical Technology.
Why I love robotics? In one sentence, I LOVE IRON MAN! The robot arm, controlled by Stark‚Äôs voice through a intelligent agent Jarvis, collaborate naturally with Tony in engineering tasks and also domestic tasks. It exacly describes my vision of robotics.
summary: Who am I My name is Mingxi Jia. I am a M.S. in Robotics student at Northeastern University, Boston. Before Northeastern, I was a research assistant at BNU-HKBU United International College, working on learning-based object 3D reconstruction, visual-aided robot arm, etc.
title: Mingxi Jia

title: Podcast1 - COVID

content:
Abstract In robotic manipulation, acquiring samples is extremely expensive because it often requires interacting with the real world. Traditional image-level data augmentation has shown the potential to improve sample efficiency in various machine learning tasks. However, image-level data augmentation is insufficient for an imitation learning agent to learn good manipulation policies in a reasonable amount of demonstrations. We propose Simulation-augmented Equivariant Imitation Learning (SEIL), a method that combines a novel data augmentation strategy of supplementing expert trajectories with simulated transitions and an equivariant model that exploits the $\mathbf{O}(2)$ symmetry in robotic manipulation. Experimental evaluations demonstrate that our method can learn non-trivial manipulation tasks within ten demonstrations and outperforms the baselines with a significant margin.
Approach 1. Equivariant Behavioral Cloning 2. Transition Simulation Results Simulation results
Real-world results
Experiments Real-world tasks Block in Bowl Trash Tidying Shoe Packing Drawer Opening Interactive close-loop bahevior Interactive Drawers Interactive ‚ÄúTrash Tidying‚Äù
title: SEIL: Simulation-augmented Equivariant Imitation Learning

summary: This paper explores this idea in the context of on-robot policy learning in which a policy must be learned entirely on a physical robotic system without reference to a model, a simulator, or an offline dataset.
title: On-Robot Learning With Equivariant Models

content: Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software. Create your slides in Markdown - click the Slides button to check out the example. Supplementary notes can be added here, including code, math, and images.
summary: We present BulletArm, a novel benchmark and learning-environment for robotic manipulation
title: BulletArm: An Open-Source Robotic Manipulation Benchmark and Learning Framework

summary: This work proposes equivariant methods for making reinforcement learning in SE(2) space more sample efficient.
title: Equivariant Reinforcement Learning for Robotic Manipulation
